newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft CFO sees NT as best opportunity.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft CFO sees NT as best opportunity.

text.p: Microsft Corp Chief Financial Officer Mike Brown said Monday that networking software is his company's best opportunity for growth in the long term.
"Windows NT is the part of our business where we have the biggest upside for growth," Brown said. The Windows NT program controls the flow of information through large corporate computer networks.
Microsoft, the world's biggest PC software company, also will rely heavily on the new version of its business software, Office 97, for revenue growth in 1997.
Brown also told investors at the Montgomery Securities Tech Week conference that Microsoft's revenue could grow faster if software piracy were curtailed.

Shares of Microsoft closed about seven percent higher on Monday, the first day of trading after a two-for-one stock split. Microsoft rose 5-3/8 to 81-3/4 on Nasdaq on volume of almost 12 million shares.
